column2: Output CSV provides daily flow organized by water year. The first flow value of the column is on the start date of the water year (e.g., Oct. 1). In leap years, columns have 366 flow values. In all other water years, columns have 365 values and there is a NA value in the final row.

Output CSV provides FFC metric results calculated for every water year of uploaded flow timeseries. If a water year within the period of record has above 100 NA values or 270 zero flow values, metrics will not be calculated for that water year. Descriptions of the results are included below, and more detailed description can be found in the eFlows documentation: https://eflows.gitbook.io/project/website_summary
Output CSV provides supplementary flow metrics to complement the 24 functional flow metrics. These are average annual flow, standard deviation, coefficient of variation, and dry season no-flow days.

column4: Description
Peak magnitude of fall pulse event (maximum daily peak flow during event)
Water year day of fall pulse event peak
Duration of fall pulse event
Magnitude of wet-season baseflows (10th percentile of daily flows within that season, including peak flow events)
Magnitude of wet-season baseflows (50th percentile of daily flows within that season, including peak flow events)
Start date of wet-season in water year days
Wet-season baseflow duration (# of days from start of wet-season to start of spring season)
2-year recurrence interval peak flow
5-year recurrence interval peak flow
10-year recurrence interval peak flow
Seasonal duration of 2-year recurrence interval peak flow (cumulative number of days in which this peak flow magnitude is exceeded)
Seasonal duration of 5-year recurrence interval peak flow (cumulative number of days in which this peak flow magnitude is exceeded)
Seasonal duration of 10-year recurrence interval peak flow (cumulative number of days in which this peak flow magnitude is exceeded)
Frequency of 2-year recurrence interval peak flow within a season
Frequency of 5-year recurrence interval peak flow within a season
Frequency of 10-year recurrence interval peak flow within a season
Spring recession magnitude (daily flow on start date of spring-flow period, 4 days after last wet-season peak)
Start date of spring in water year days
Spring flow recession duration (# of days from start of spring to start of dry-season baseflow period)
Spring flow recession rate (median daily rate of change over decreasing periods during the recession)
50th percentile of daily flow within dry season
90th percentile of daily flow within dry season
Dry-season baseflow start timing (water year day of dry season)
Dry-season baseflow duration (# of days from start of dry season to start of wet season)
Flow Metric Description
Average annual flow
Stardard deviation of daily flow
Coefficient of variation (standard deviation divided by average annual flow)
Number of days during dry season in which flow magnitude is 0 cfs
